links.explicacion: The measurement of stellar parallax provided direct evidence that supports the heliocentric model by demonstrating that stars are at varying distances from Earth, contrary to the geocentric model's assumption that stars are fixed on a celestial sphere.
links.target: First successful measure of stellar parallax

links.explicacion: The understanding and interpretation of radio sources in astronomy are based on the heliocentric model, which allows astronomers to correctly locate and study celestial objects in the universe.
The discovery of Uranus was facilitated by the heliocentric model, which now included the outer planets in the solar system's framework.
The prediction and subsequent discovery of Neptune relied heavily on perturbations in the orbit of Uranus, which could only be accurately understood using the heliocentric model of our solar system.
The study and prediction of the properties and locations of white dwarfs are based on our understanding of stellar evolution, which assumes a heliocentric model.
The observation of redshifts in the spectra of galaxies supports the expanding universe theory, which was built upon a heliocentric understanding of celestial motion and distances.
Understanding the human anatomy, particularly the cardiovascular system, was crucial for William Harvey's discovery of how blood circulates in the body.
Detailed knowledge of human anatomy was essential to safely administer anesthesia and perform surgeries.
A deep understanding of the human anatomy, particularly the chest and the organs within, was necessary for the invention and effective use of the stethoscope.
While not directly dependent, the anatomical studies contributed to safer and more efficient designs in appliances, including those used for cooking and potentially preventing injuries.
Understanding respiratory anatomy was crucial for developing devices that allow humans to breathe in environments where oxygen is limited.
Establishing rules for arithmetic involving complex numbers relies on algebraic manipulation.
Group theory is rooted in the systematic algebraic manipulation of elements within mathematical structures.
Boolean algebra is a system of algebraic manipulation using modern notation.
The formulation and manipulation of equations in non-Euclidean geometry depend on algebraic methods.
An early mechanical computer designed to systematically perform algebraic manipulations.
Involves algebraic manipulation to describe electromagnetic fields through Maxwell's equations.
The equation is a fundamental formula in quantum mechanics, requiring algebraic manipulation for its application and solutions.
Another quantum mechanical equation which necessitates advanced algebraic manipulation.
Its proof involves sophisticated algebraic manipulations.
Verifying the speed of light required accurate astronomical observations facilitated by the optical telescope.
links.target: First measurement of the speed of light

links.explicacion: The discovery of this celestial body was made possible using an optical telescope.
This astronomical achievement was attained through observations made by optical telescopes.
links.target: First successful measure of stellar parallax

links.explicacion: The initial identification of cosmic radio sources often involved optical telescopic confirmations.
The first identification of a white dwarf star was achieved using an optical telescope.
Reflecting telescopes, which utilized mirrors instead of lenses, were developed due to advancements in telescopic observations.
The invention of the first compound microscopes in Europe was pivotal in allowing Robert Hooke to observe and describe cells, a fundamental breakthrough in biology.
The use of compound microscopes enabled experiments that provided evidence against spontaneous generation.
Antonie van Leeuwenhoek's observations were made possible by the advancements in microscopy.
links.target: Observes microorganisms using a refined simple microscope

links.explicacion: The study of insect development required the use of compound microscopes to observe cellular and developmental processes.
This fundamental principle of cell theory relies on observations made possible by compound microscopes.
links.target: Cells can only arise from pre-existing cells

links.explicacion: Reflecting telescopes use mirrors to refract light and form images, and their design depends on the principles outlined by Snell's law.
Measuring the speed of light required precise understanding of light refraction, which is directly connected to Snell's law.
links.target: First measurement of the speed of light

links.explicacion: This advanced microscopy technique depends on the understanding of light refraction and phase shifts, which are governed by Snell's law.
This conclusion was directly dependent on the observation of cells using microscopes.
links.target: All plants are made of cells

links.explicacion: This understanding fundamentally relies on the prior discovery of cells.
links.target: Cells can only arise from pre-existing cells

links.explicacion: The germ theory of disease depended on the study of microorganisms, which could only be observed after the discovery of cells.
Observing microorganisms was made possible by the discovery and study of cells.
links.target: Observes microorganisms using a refined simple microscope

links.explicacion: The development of cell lines for research, such as HeLa cells, is directly tied to the discovery of cells.
While this invention is more related to astronomy, it involves precision and advancements in optical instruments linked to improved microscopy and understanding of cells.
links.target: First successful measure of stellar parallax

links.explicacion: The disproved idea of spontaneous generation was key to demonstrating the necessity of eliminating microorganisms to prevent spoilage and disease.
Understanding that infections were caused by microorganisms and not spontaneous generation was fundamental to developing antibiotics.
This depended on the germ theory of disease, rooted in the disproved idea of spontaneous generation.
The understanding that fossils are organic remains was crucial to establishing the concept that species could become extinct, as fossils provided physical evidence of species that no longer existed.
links.source: proposes that fossils are organic remains

links.explicacion: The study of fossils as organic remains provided essential evidence supporting the theory of continental drift, as similar fossils found on separate continents indicated the continents were once connected.
links.source: proposes that fossils are organic remains

links.explicacion: The fundamental understanding of the spectrum of white light was crucial for the development of color photography processes.
links.source: white light is a mixture of distinct colored rays (the spectrum)

links.explicacion: The calculus was crucial for understanding the propagation of light and the refinement of processes to measure its speed.
links.target: First measurement of the speed of light

links.explicacion: Newton's laws of motion and universal gravitation are deeply rooted in the use of infinitesimal calculus.
links.target: Classical mathematical description of gravitation and laws of motion

links.explicacion: The experiment required precise measurements and calculations, which heavily relied on calculus.
Einstein's work on both topics required the application of calculus for the proper formulation of theories and interpretation of data.
Maxwell’s equations, which describe the fundamentals of electromagnetism, are formulated using calculus.
The development of this theory relied heavily on advanced calculus.
The design of the Analytical Engine by Charles Babbage used calculus principles to envision computation and algorithms.
Mathematical models of evolution developed later relied on calculus to describe genetic change over time.
links.target: Theory of evolution by natural selection

links.explicacion: Requires calculus for the formulation of models that describe the expansion of the universe.
The theory of general relativity fundamentally uses calculus to describe the curvature of spacetime.
The formulation of quantum mechanics is based on differential equations derived using calculus.
Utilizes calculus for its formulation and provides the basis for understanding relativistic quantum mechanics.
The calculus was crucial for understanding the propagation of light and refining the measurements.
links.target: first measurement of the speed of light

links.explicacion: The principles involved in this quantum phenomenon rely heavily on advanced calculus.
The technique and its modeling are deeply rooted in calculus.
The design and optimization process were based on calculus principles.
The development and refinement of electronic circuits depended on calculus for signal processing.
Calculus is essential in the design and understanding of laser systems.
Utilizes calculus for computations of positions and navigation data.
The planning of orbital mechanics and station keeping used calculus extensively.
The operational principles and development of transistor technology required extensive use of calculus in semiconductor physics.
Understanding this phenomenon involved the application of calculus.
Einstein’s theory fundamentally uses calculus to describe gravity and the curvature of spacetime.
Calculus is fundamental in this area of topological theory.
The mathematical description required calculus.

The understanding of latent heat was crucial for the development of refrigeration technology, which relies on the principles of phase changes in refrigerants.
Knowledge of latent heat was fundamental in enhancing the efficiency of steam engines through better management of heat in phase transitions.
The concept of latent heat is essential for the thermodynamic analysis of heat engines, particularly in understanding phase changes and energy efficiency in the Carnot cycle.

The discovery that lightning is electrical was fundamental in the development of the lightning rod by Benjamin Franklin, which provided a method to protect buildings and structures by safely directing electrical charges to the ground.

links.explicacion: Requires a fundamental understanding of atomic structure and reactions, which is underpinned by the Atomic Theory in chemistry.
Relies on the behavior of atomic nuclei in magnetic fields, a concept derived from atomic theory.
Understanding molecular composition and interactions at an atomic level is essential.
links.target: DNA is the genetic material of the chromosome

links.explicacion: Semiconductor physics heavily relies on principles of atomic theory.
Investigating the chemical origins of life requires knowledge of atomic and molecular interactions.
Determining the atomic structure of the DNA molecule was critical in elucidating its function.
Requires an understanding of electron interactions in materials, grounded in atomic theory.
The understanding and development of efficient internal combustion engines were significantly influenced by thermodynamic cycles, including the Carnot cycle.
The Diesel engine's efficiency and principles are grounded in the thermodynamic concepts of cycles, including the Carnot cycle.
The efficiency and thermodynamic principles governing jet engines are influenced by the Carnot cycle.
The operation of electric motors depends on the understanding of electrical current, voltage, and resistance.
Relays require precise control of electrical circuits governed by Ohm's law.
The transmission of electrical signals and functioning of telegraph systems rely on the principles set out by Ohm's law.
The efficiency and functioning of fuel cells are influenced by Ohm's law in terms of internal resistance and voltage.
The design and functioning of these machines require understanding the relationship between voltage, current, and resistance.
links.target: First commutated rotary electromechanical machine with electromagnets

links.explicacion: This process uses electric current to form metal parts and Ohm's law is fundamental in controlling current and voltage.
Requires understanding of electrical resistance and voltage to send and receive signals.
Non-Euclidean geometry was fundamental to Albert Einstein's theory of general relativity, which describes the gravitational force as a curvature of spacetime.
The discovery of redshift in galaxies relies on the Doppler effect to establish that galaxies are moving away from us, a key piece of evidence for the expanding universe.
The measurement of the velocity of Cepheid variables depends on the Doppler effect to understand their movement and hence calculate distances in the universe.
The Doppler effect is fundamental in observing the redshift of galaxies, which provided the observational foundation for Hubble's law and the concept of the expanding universe.
links.target: Hubble's law of the expanding universe

links.explicacion: The detection and analysis of X-ray sources in space depend on understanding their motion, often determined using the Doppler effect.
The study of pulsars, including millisecond pulsars, involves measuring their radial velocities using the Doppler effect to understand their behavior and properties.
The discovery of planets around pulsars involved measuring variations in the pulsar timing due to Doppler shifts caused by the orbital motion of the planets.
One method of detecting gravitational waves involves observing changes in the Doppler shifts of timing signals from pulsars, which can be affected by these waves passing through.
The internal combustion engine's operation is governed by the First Law of Thermodynamics, as it converts chemical energy into mechanical energy.
links.source: Law of Conservation of energy (First law of thermodynamics)
links.target: Early internal combustion engine capable of doing useful work

links.explicacion: Gas turbines depend on the principles of thermodynamics and energy conservation in their operation, converting fuel energy into mechanical energy.
links.source: Law of Conservation of energy (First law of thermodynamics)

links.explicacion: Turbo-jet engines are designed based on principles from the First Law of Thermodynamics to ensure the efficient conversion of fuel energy into thrust.
links.source: Law of Conservation of energy (First law of thermodynamics)

links.explicacion: These devices manipulate thermal energy for cooling, directly applying the principles of energy conservation in thermodynamic processes.
links.source: Law of Conservation of energy (First law of thermodynamics)

links.explicacion: This method, which is a refined form of steelmaking, is based on decarbonization and requires an understanding of the carbon content control in iron and steel.
The production of martensitic stainless steel involves decarbonization and re-carbonization steps to control the carbon content and achieve the desired hardness and corrosion resistance.
This open hearth process for steelmaking leverages the principles of decarbonization and re-carbonization of iron to produce steel with desired properties.
The invention and production of stainless steel necessitated advanced methods of controlling carbon content in iron, demonstrating the importance of decarbonization and re-carbonization.
El descubrimiento de la teoría germinal de enfermedades fue fundamental para el desarrollo de los antibióticos, como la penicilina, al identificar bacterias específicas como causas de infecciones.
La producción masiva de penicilina es un desarrollo directo de la teoría germinal, que permitió su uso generalizado en el tratamiento de infecciones bacterianas.
El desarrollo de vacunas, incluido el de la polio, se basó en la comprensión de que virus específicos causan enfermedades infecciosas, un concepto central de la teoría germinal.
La implementación de mascarillas quirúrgicas está directamente relacionada con la teoría germinal, que mostró que las enfermedades se transmiten por microorganismos en el aire.
El método de pasteurización se basa en eliminar los microorganismos dañinos en alimentos y bebidas, confirmado por la teoría germinal.

The development of germ theory relied heavily on the observation of bacteria and other microorganisms using compound microscopes, leading to a revolutionary understanding of disease causation and prevention.

Understanding of the greenhouse effect and radiant energy would have been crucial for the development of rocket technology, especially in designing efficient fuel systems and predicting the behavior of rockets in varying atmospheric conditions.
links.source: Experiments in Radiant Energy and Greenhouse effect

links.explicacion: The principles of radiant energy transfer are essential for the design and efficiency of gas turbines, which rely on the conversion of thermal energy to mechanical energy.
links.source: Experiments in Radiant Energy and Greenhouse effect

links.explicacion: Employs electromagnetism to create arcing for welding purposes.
This finding built on Mendel's laws of inheritance to identify DNA as the carrier of genetic information.
links.target: DNA is the genetic material of the chromosome

links.explicacion: The understanding of hereditary patterns from Mendel’s laws was crucial for the discovery and conceptualization of the double helix structure of DNA.
Sequencing DNA relies fundamentally on Mendel's understanding of inheritance for mapping and comprehending genetic information.
This massive effort to map human genetic material was fundamentally based on Mendelian principles of inheritance.
The distribution of Mendel's work was facilitated by the printing press, enabling wide dissemination.
This definition elaborated on the concept initially introduced in thermodynamics, establishing its statistical mechanical interpretation mainly due to the work of Ludwig Boltzmann.
This law, stating that the entropy of a perfect crystal at absolute zero is zero, directly stems from the definition of entropy.
The concept of entropy is integral in cosmological models, including the Big Bang, as it relates to the evolution of the universe's thermodynamic state.
The phenomena and theoretical models explaining high-temperature superconductors involve complex considerations of entropy.
The storage and stability of RNA vaccines are influenced by entropy-related considerations, particularly in maintaining the correct structure and functional integrity at various temperatures.

links.explicacion: The development of the thermionic emission was critical for the creation of the vacuum tubes necessary for early radio transmitters and receivers.
Guglielmo Marconi's wireless communication system relied heavily on vacuum tubes that function due to thermionic emission.
Early televisions used cathode ray tubes, which operate due to thermionic emission.
The electronic television was made possible by vacuum tubes utilizing thermionic emission.
Uses an electron gun that emits electrons through thermionic emission.
The technology relies on vacuum tubes that operate using thermionic emission.
Although different from vacuum tubes, the first transistors were built upon the principles understood through the study of thermionic emission.
Relying on the statistical definition of entropy to describe absolute entropy values.
Claude Shannon’s foundational work in information theory uses the statistical definition of entropy directly.
Uses quartz crystal oscillators, which operate based on piezoelectricity to keep time with high accuracy.
Relies on the piezoelectric properties of crystals to generate precise frequency signals.
Utilized piezoelectric crystals in the design of the early televisions for signal processing.
Utilizes piezoelectric materials to generate precise high-frequency oscillations.
links.target: High power, microwave generating, cavity magnetron

links.explicacion: Some types of transistors rely on piezoelectric materials, especially in RF applications and sensors.
Employ piezoelectric crystals for fine-tuning and stabilizing the laser output.
Certain designs of capacitive touchscreens utilize piezoelectric materials to detect touch inputs more accurately.
Utilizes piezoelectric elements in the ultrasonic atomizer to convert liquid into vapor.
The Michelson–Morley experiment was crucial in demonstrating the constancy of the speed of light in all inertial frames of reference, paving the way for Einstein's theory of special relativity.

The failure to detect the expected movement of the Earth through the aether in the Michelson–Morley experiment supported the necessity for new physics, contributing to the development of general relativity.
This technology was crucial for visualizing viruses, which are too small to be seen with light microscopes.
Developed by Jonas Salk for polio, this form of vaccine specifically targets viruses.
Advanced by Dennis Gabor, holography contributed significantly to the study and visualization of viruses.
The principles of nuclear fission and radioactivity are directly essential for the creation of atomic bombs.
This process, which involves splitting the nucleus of an atom, relies fundamentally on the concept of radioactivity.
This technique depends on measuring the radioactivity of carbon isotopes to determine the age of organic materials.
Analyzes materials based on the magnetic properties of atomic nuclei, which involves principles of radioactivity.
The isolation of these radioactive elements by Marie Curie is a direct consequence of the discovery of radioactivity.
While not directly dependent on radioactivity, advancements in understanding atomic and subatomic structures, influenced by radioactivity, were crucial for its development.
This process dates back to research in radioactivity to achieve the splitting of atomic nuclei.
Similar to nuclear fission by neutron irradiation, it is rooted in the principles of radioactivity.
While primarily a medical and biological breakthrough, the use of radioactive isotopes was critical in early cancer research and treatments.
The discovery of viruses led to the understanding of various infectious agents, which in turn propelled research into antibiotics and the subsequent discovery of penicillin as a treatment.
Directly relates to the discovery and understanding of how viruses function, enabling the development of vaccines that target viral infections without causing disease.
Without the fundamental understanding of viruses, the development of vaccines against viral diseases such as polio would not have been possible.

The modern development of RNA vaccines is based on extensive research into viral genetics and replication mechanisms, crucial for producing effective vaccines against viral pathogens, including the COVID-19 virus.
The understanding of the atomic nucleus was fundamental for the development of nuclear fission, which is the principle behind atomic bombs.
The discovery of the atomic nucleus was crucial for the understanding and subsequent experimental splitting of atomic nuclei which is nuclear fission.
NMR relies on the properties of atomic nuclei.
The detailed knowledge of the structure and behavior of atomic nuclei was essential.
This technique required an understanding of atomic nuclei and their reactions.
Involves interactions at the level of atomic nuclei.
Telescopic observations and spectroscopy were key to discovering that the Sun is primarily composed of hydrogen and helium.
links.source: Discovery of the composition of the Sun

links.explicacion: Observations made with telescopes were fundamental to formulate Hubble's Law and understand the expanding universe.
links.source: Hubble's law of the expanding universe

links.explicacion: The discovery of the neutron made it possible to understand and utilize nuclear fission, which was a cornerstone for advancements in nuclear power and weaponry.
Without the discovery of the neutron, the understanding and application of fission of heavy nuclei, such as uranium and plutonium, would not have been possible.
The production and application of isotopes like plutonium-239 for nuclear reactions required an understanding of neutron behavior and interactions.
The development and utilization of the atomic bomb depended critically on the principles of neutron-induced fission.
This technique relies on the properties of nuclei, including neutrons, to provide detailed information about the structure of molecules.
The design and functionality of thermonuclear weapons are deeply rooted in the physics of neutrons and their role in nuclear reactions.
The study and understanding of high-temperature superconductivity involve knowledge of exotic states of matter, which can be influenced by neutron scattering experiments.
Techniques and technologies developed to detect neutrons form a foundation for subsequent advancements in nuclear physics and various applied sciences.
While quantum computing as we know it is based on a broader set of quantum mechanics principles, many foundational experiments involved the study of neutron behavior.
Isotope of plutonium which is a byproduct of nuclear fission used in nuclear reactors and weapons.
Depended on the principles of nuclear fission to release enormous amounts of energy.
Although primarily involving nuclear fusion, the device also relied on nuclear fission as a trigger mechanism.
Utilizes Nuclear Magnetic Resonance to produce detailed images of organs and tissues.
This imaging technology relies on electromagnetic induction to produce high-resolution images of the inside of the body.

Mobile communication technologies leverage concepts from information theory.
Uses principles from information theory to manage and optimize communication.

Effective digital audio compression techniques derive from information theory.
Streaming and compressing video data heavily leverage information and coding theory principles.
Uses algorithms for data compression and transmission based on information theory.
Relies on communication technologies underpinned by information theory for data transmission.
Uses audio compression schemes derived from information theory.
While this might seem unrelated, the computational biology approaches used in its discovery can be connected to methods in information theory.

links.explicacion: Public-key cryptography is essential for secure transactions and wallet management in cryptocurrency systems.
Relies directly on public-key cryptography for verifying the authenticity and integrity of digital messages or documents.
Essential for secure web browsing, relies on public-key cryptography to encrypt data transmitted over the internet.
The first DNA genome sequencing was fundamental for mapping and understanding the entirety of human DNA.
This technique of identifying individuals based on their genetic makeup relies on DNA sequencing.
Employed DNA profiling to verify the genetic identity of the cloned sheep.
La secuenciación de células individuales requiere de conocimientos avanzados de genética y la información proporcionada por el Proyecto del Genoma Humano.
La edición de genomas CRISPR se basa en un entendimiento detallado del ADN humano, facilitado por el Proyecto del Genoma Humano.
Las vacunas de ARN fueron desarrolladas utilizando la información genética y las secuencias de ADN reveladas por el Proyecto del Genoma Humano.
This project relied heavily on advanced DNA sequencing methods to map the entire human genome.
Relied on DNA profiling to map the entire human genome.
DNA profiling was essential in confirming the synthetic creation and functionality of these cells.
Used DNA profiling methods to sequence the Neanderthal genome.
The fire lance, an early form of gunpowder weapon, laid the foundational technology for explosive bombs.
Directly evolved from the fire lance, the hand cannon was another application of gunpowder in weaponry.
The fire lance's utilization of gunpowder was key to the development of larger gunpowder artillery like cannons.
An evolution in firearms, developing from previous gunpowder weapons such as the fire lance.
While different in application, the use of gunpowder propellants in metal-cylinder rockets can be traced back to inventions like the fire lance.
Required the availability of strong, reliable steel for the barrel and cylinder.
Dependence on durable steel for reliable operation.
links.target: First repeating rifle to use metallic cartridges

links.explicacion: Required steel for construction of durable and efficient motors.
Steel was critical for creating durable components for receivers and transmission devices.
Transformer's cores and windings required high-quality steel.
Dependió del uso de la **Endless power-transmitting chain drive (1832)** en maquinaria para la precisión en fabricación.
Desarrollos en mayores aplicaciones y innovaciones manufacturados que aprovecharon los inventos de mediana época como la **Endless power-transmitting chain drive (1832)**.
Requisito para mejorar los sistemas de producción en los que los **Endless power-transmitting chain drive (1832)** jugaron un papel crucial.
links.target: First practical method for color photography

links.explicacion: Dependió directamente del uso de cadenas infinitas de transmisión de potencia.
Mejoró sus aplicaciones gracias a los avances en sistemas de transmisión de potencia altamente eficientes como la **Endless power-transmitting chain drive (1832)**.
Experimentación inicial en vehículos que más tarde aprovecharían la transmisión eficiente de **Endless power-transmitting chain drive (1832)**.
Producción y diseño mejorados con el uso de **Endless power-transmitting chain drive (1832)** en maquinaria textil.
La producción y experimentación con metales precisos facilitada por cadenas de transmisión de potencia infinitas.
Aspectos de manufactura y producción precisas mejoradas con las tecnologías avanzadas de la época.
Utilización de sistemas avanzados de manufactura apoyados en tecnologías de cadenas de transmisión.
links.target: First automobile powered by an internal combustion engine fueled by hydrogen

links.explicacion: The mechanical escapement was crucial for the regulation of pendulum clocks, as it converted the pendulum's motion into minute time increments, ensuring accurate timekeeping.
The mechanical escapement was essential for the development of early mechanical calculators, providing precise control and regulation of the calculation process.
Early pendulum clocks used coil springs for the operation of the pendulum, aiding in timekeeping accuracy.
Coil springs were used in the piano mechanism for key action and to return hammers to their resting positions.
Coil springs are an essential part of the safety mechanisms in elevators.
Ball screws use coil springs for recirculation and preloading purposes.
The creation of mainspring was fundamental to the development of spring-powered pendulum clocks.
The mass production and distribution of newspapers were made possible by the printing press.
The dissemination of scientific research relied on the ability to mass-produce documents.
The telescope was essential for the accurate astronomical observations needed to measure the speed of light.
links.target: First measurement of the speed of light

links.explicacion: Telescopes are necessary to observe stars and measure their parallax, providing evidence of Earth's movement through space.
links.target: First successful measure of stellar parallax

links.explicacion: The development and use of compound microscopes enabled the discovery and observation of cells, which was not possible with the naked eye or earlier magnifying tools.

The use of compound microscopes was crucial in the experiments that disproved spontaneous generation, as they allowed scientists to observe microorganisms directly and understand their behavior and life cycles.
The study of epigenesis in insects required detailed observations of embryonic development, which was facilitated by compound microscopes.

The discovery and study of viruses were made possible through the advancements in microscopy provided by compound microscopes, although electron microscopes later provided even more detailed observations.
While this refers to a simple microscope, the earlier development and advancements made in compound microscopes paved the way for more refined designs and observations.
links.target: Observes microorganisms using a refined simple microscope

links.explicacion: This fundamental biological principle was established through detailed observations of cell division using compound microscopes.
links.target: Cells can only arise from pre-existing cells

links.explicacion: Requiere de la bomba de vacío para expulsar el aire y luego comprimirlo.
Su desarrollo necesitó de la bomba de vacío para eliminar el aire de los espejos para evitar distorsiones ópticas.
Advances in telescope technology, including reflecting telescopes, facilitated more precise astronomical measurements, including those related to the speed of light.
links.target: First measurement of the speed of light

links.explicacion: This invention directly relies on a piston engine for its operation.
links.target: First automobile powered by an internal combustion engine fuelled by hydrogen

links.explicacion: This engine type, a variant of an internal combustion engine, fundamentally depends on the piston mechanism for converting fuel into mechanical work.
Although more complex and involving turbines, the principles originated from the piston engine concepts and its mechanical fundamentals.
Uses a crank mechanism that inherently relies on principles derived from the development of the piston engine.
Indirectly depends on the piston engine since it was created to solve issues arising from automobile use, which based on the piston engine.
Directly relies on the piston engine to convert gasoline into motion.
James Watt’s improvements on the steam engine were directly influenced by the need for more efficient versions of the early commercial steam engines.
This development was an application of the steam engine technology to create transportation methods.
links.target: First steam-powered vehicle capable of carrying passengers

links.explicacion: The development of the steam engine was essential for harnessing rail transportation.
Robert Fulton’s steamboat relied on steam engine technology for river and maritime transportation.

The flying shuttle enabled weavers to produce cloth more quickly, which created a bottleneck in the spinning process. This led to the invention of the first mechanized cotton spinning machine to keep up with the increased demand for spun cotton.
The flying shuttle increased weaving speeds, revealing the need for more thread production. The spinning jenny was invented to meet this increased demand for thread.
The flying shuttle's efficiency in weaving was a precursor to the development of automated weaving machines like the power loom, which further revolutionized the textile industry.
Though developed almost concurrently, its efficiency was subsequently enhanced by the mechanized cotton spinning machine, which provided more consistent and plentiful yarn.
The mechanized spinning machine provided the necessary bulk cotton yarn for power looms, making large-scale fabric production feasible.
While the cotton gin separated seeds from cotton fibers, the mechanized spinning machine was crucial for efficiently spinning the processed cotton into yarn or thread.
Early experiments and demonstrations often involved the use of Leyden jars for producing high-voltage discharges.
The Leyden jar was instrumental in generating and storing the high-voltage charges necessary for early telegraphy experiments.
links.target: First working electric telegraph using electrostatic means

links.explicacion: Research on Leyden jars contributed to understanding high-voltage electricity and storage, essential for later developments in microwave and radio technologies.
links.target: High power, microwave generating, cavity magnetron

links.explicacion: The improved steam engine provided the necessary power and efficiency for early steam-powered vehicles.
links.target: First steam-powered vehicle capable of carrying passengers

links.explicacion: The advancements in steam engine technology were critical for the success of the first steamboat.
The improved steam engine was fundamental for the development of steam locomotives.
This invention relied on the principles of the improved steam engine for its operation.
The improved steam engine technology was essential for the operation of steam hammers.
The improved steam engine laid the groundwork for the development of more advanced steam-powered machinery like the steam turbine.
Modern rocketry, which is heavily influenced by the development of metal-cylinder rockets, reached a significant milestone with the first liquid-fueled rocket.
The V-2 rocket, developed during World War II, built upon earlier advancements in rocket technology, particularly those involving metal-cylinder rockets.
The launch of Sputnik 1, the first artificial Earth satellite, relied on advancements in rocketry, rooted in early metal-cylinder rocket technology.
While the machine itself was mechanical, the widespread availability of paper was essential for documentation and development of computational theory and design.
The increased availability of paper was necessary for the efficiency of powered printing presses.
Paper was essential for the plans, blueprints, and documentation necessary to develop and innovate mechanical devices.
This development is indirectly influenced as the availability of paper products like toilet paper became more widespread, aligning with the adoption of public flush toilets.
The use of paper for blueprints was essential in architecture and engineering for planning and design.
This invention also directly relies on the internal combustion engine for its operation.

links.explicacion: The internal combustion engine's principles are fundamental to the operation of liquid-fueled rockets.
links.source: early internal combustion engine capable of doing useful work

links.explicacion: It is also an advanced application of the internal combustion engine technology.

links.explicacion: The development of artificial refrigeration significantly enhanced the canning process by enabling long-term storage of perishable food items before and after canning.
The dandy horse is considered the precursor to the modern bicycle, influencing its development and design.

The development of the tunnelling shield allowed for safer and more advanced underground construction, which indirectly facilitated infrastructure advancements including the construction needed for road networks supporting the use of vehicles with pneumatic tires.
The use of tunnelling shields was crucial for the construction of large-scale tunnels such as the Channel Tunnel, which is a direct application of the technology for creating long underwater tunnels.
Utilized electromagnets as a fundamental component.
links.target: First commutated rotary electromechanical machine with electromagnets

links.explicacion: Required electromagnets to convert electrical energy into mechanical energy.
Relied on electromagnets to control switches in electrical circuits.
Employed electromagnets in the construction of the telegraph system for sending coded messages.
The method of electromagnetic induction is essential for the operation of electric motors.
Relays use the principle of electromagnetic induction to create a temporary magnetic field that moves contacts to open or close electrical circuits.
The telegraph systems that transmitted Morse code signals relied on electromagnetic induction for the generation and detection of the electrical pulses.
Telephones utilize electromagnetic induction for converting sound into electrical signals and vice versa.
Heaters in electric ovens rely on electromagnetic induction to convert electrical energy into heat.
The deflection and modulation of electron beams in cathode-ray tube-based televisions depended on the principles of electromagnetic induction.
Communication systems like radio transmitters and receivers utilize electromagnetic induction for broadcasting and receiving signals.
Although primarily a chemical device, the charging process of batteries can involve principles of electromagnetic induction.
The electromechanical relay was used to transmit signals over long distances.
While the process primarily involves forming a metal object on a mold using electroplating, the precision control of electricity required benefits greatly from relay technology.
This invention also relied on Morse code to transmit printed messages over distances.

While not directly related to Morse code, the widespread infrastructure improvements such as telegraphy had an indirect influence on urban planning and public utilities including public flush toilets.
The electrotyping process was used to create daguerreotype plates, which were fundamental for early photographic processes.
Electrotyping was critical in producing metal plates for making blueprints, which were essential for accurate architectural and engineering drawings.

El propio "blueprint" es un descubrimiento e invento fundamental en sí mismo, proporcionando una técnica revolucionaria para reproducir y duplicar planos técnicos y diseños. Esto tuvo un impacto crucial en diversas innovaciones y en la ingeniería debido a la posibilidad de transmitir diseños precisos de manera accesible y confiable.
Dinamite se elabora mezclando nitroglicerina con tierra de diatomeas, convirtiéndose en un explosivo seguro para manejo.
The improved quality and production of steel from the Bessemer process were crucial in the mass manufacturing of reliable disk drives.

1. **Parkesine (1862)**: Considerado el primer plástico, se desarrolló original e independientemente de Mauveine. posteriormente se descubrió que los colorantes sintéticos como Mauveine se podian usar para pigmentar un material que general como el Parkesine, aunque no fue un componente fundamental para su existencia. señalando que si bien tal colorante no fue fundamental, se menciona su uso.
Early televisions required dependable and rechargeable power sources, like the lead-acid battery, to function efficiently.

The technology behind television broadcasts was supported by reliable electrical storage systems such as lead-acid batteries, especially for maintaining constant power supplies during broadcast sessions.

The development of tanks heavily relied on materials capable of withstanding harsh conditions, such as corrosion and high temperatures. Stainless steel's properties made it an ideal material for certain tank components.
This is self-referential but included to denote the specific type of stainless steel invented.
The Gramme machine was fundamental in providing a reliable source of electric power for the operation of the first electric tram.
While the basic concept of the telephone was developed earlier, the Gramme machine played a crucial role in generating the steady electric current needed for long-distance communication.
The Gramme machine provided the necessary electrical power for the mechanical parts of Edison's phonograph to function effectively.
The Gramme machine was essential for generating the electricity required to power the first practical incandescent light bulbs developed by Thomas Edison.
Although gasoline engines were central to the operation, the Gramme machine was used to provide electrical power for ignition systems and other electrical components.
The Gramme machine facilitated the generation of electricity, which could be used to power the machinery involved in the operation and development of modern steam turbines.
The Gramme machine was essential in providing consistent and reliable electric power for the processes involved in early color photography techniques.
links.target: First practical method for color photography

links.explicacion: The efficiency and practicality of the internal combustion engine in gasoline-powered cars were significantly enhanced by the Four-stroke cycle.
The Diesel engine is a type of internal combustion engine that operates using a modified version of the Four-stroke cycle.
This engine relies on the principles of the Four-stroke cycle for its operational efficiency.
The Hall–Héroult process is essential for supplying aluminum used in the aviation industry for constructing aircraft components.
links.target: First airplane made from Bessemer process steel

links.explicacion: Aluminum, produced efficiently using the Hall–Héroult process, was a critical material in the framework of the Zeppelin airships.
Helicopters depend on lightweight structures made possible by aluminum produced through the Hall–Héroult process.
The Hall–Héroult process is vital for the production of aluminum used in the components and casings of early televisions.
The manufacturing of the cavity magnetron, a crucial component in radar systems and microwave ovens, heavily depends on aluminum processed via the Hall–Héroult method.
links.target: High power, microwave generating, cavity magnetron

links.explicacion: The Hall–Héroult process is essential for producing the aluminum used in transistor manufacturing.
One of the first computers used aluminum, essential for its construction and components, derived from the Hall–Héroult process.
The production of integrated circuits relies on aluminum, which is obtained using the Hall–Héroult process, for interconnects and other structural components.
The Hall–Héroult process is directly responsible for the mass production of aluminum used in beverage cans.
Modern cell phones incorporate aluminum in various components, including casings and internal structures, made possible by the Hall–Héroult process.
The production of iPhones and similar smartphones relies on aluminum, which is obtained through the Hall–Héroult process, for the device’s casing and other integral components.

The Kinetoscope was a precursor to motion picture projectors like the Cinematograph. The basic idea of presenting moving images was first successfully demonstrated by the Kinetoscope, paving the way for more advanced projection technologies.

The concept of visual storytelling using moving images began with the Kinetoscope. While television broadcasting incorporates additional technologies for signal transmission over distances, the foundational idea of displaying sequential images for entertainment and information-sharing traces back to the Kinetoscope.

As with the first television broadcast, practical television systems built on the idea of creating a visual narrative by showing motion pictures, a concept rooted in the Kinetoscope's early developments.
This invention draws from the same root technology of sequential image presentation established by the Kinetoscope.
The concept of creating and sharing motion pictures, which originated with the Kinetoscope, underpins platforms like YouTube where videos can be uploaded, shared, and viewed globally.
Relies on electromagnetic wave propagation.
Uses electron beams, a concept arising from wave theory and electromagnetic theory.
Employs radio waves to detect objects and determine their range, speed, and other characteristics.
Transmits moving images and sound through electromagnetic waves.
Operates based on the principles of electromagnetic emission.
La televisión evolucionó a partir de tecnologías de proyección de imágenes en movimiento, originalmente desarrolladas a partir de inventos como el Cinematograph.
La televisión electrónica requirió tecnologías y principios cinematográficos introducidos por el Cinematograph.
Las primeras transmisiones televisivas dependían de la tecnología y la práctica que surgieron del desarrollo del Cinematograph.
Required the knowledge of x-rays to understand how electrons can be used to form images at a much higher resolution than light.
Utilizes x-ray technology to detect and measure the ratio of carbon isotopes for dating organic materials.
Discovering the electron required the technology of x-rays and cathode rays that led to the ability to observe and demonstrate their existence.
Polyethylene is used in the manufacturing of the tracks and some components of the cars.
Polyethylene is used as an insulator for electrical wiring and components in modern trams.
Laminated glass is necessary for the construction of sturdy and shatterproof windows and windshields in rotary-wing aircraft, ensuring pilot and passenger safety.
Laminated glass is used in the vision blocks and windows of tanks, providing essential ballistic protection while allowing visibility.
Rocket technology builds on principles of flight and propulsion initially explored in heavier-than-air powered flight.
Rotary-wing aircraft or helicopters are direct advancements in the understanding of controlled powered flight.
Jet propulsion technology is an advancement stemming from the core principles of heavier-than-air powered flight.
Delivery systems for these weapons often involve aircraft capable of powered flight.
Required the discovery of television broadcasting to transmit live images.
Developed to receive and display the images transmitted by the first television broadcast.
A modern platform for live streaming content which fundamentally relies on the concept of television broadcasting to deliver live video content over the internet.

High power microwave generating technologies, including the cavity magnetron, were critical in the development of radar technology during World War II, which subsequently influenced electronic advancements, including television broadcasting systems.
links.target: High power, microwave generating, cavity magnetron

links.explicacion: The Pu-239 isotope is a key material used in the core of nuclear weapons.
The development of thermonuclear weapons relied on Pu-239 as a trigger for the fusion process.
Uses isotopic analysis techniques developed in the context of nuclear research.
The cavity magnetron technology was fundamental for the development of the microwave oven, which relies on the generation of microwaves to heat food.

links.explicacion: Utilized non-infectious viral vaccines to provide immunity against poliovirus.
Uses the concept of non-infectious viral components to elicit an immune response without causing disease.
The hard disk drive played a crucial role in the storage and processing of data required for the development and operation of the first mobile web.
Quantum machines rely heavily on data storage solutions, including hard disk drives, to handle massive computational tasks and data management.
The development of RNA vaccines, such as those for COVID-19, depends on genomic sequencing and bioinformatics, which require substantial data storage capabilities provided by hard disk drives.
Twitch’s streaming platform requires significant storage capabilities for video data, which are handled by hard disk drives.
Early mobile phones and the infrastructure supporting them required hard disk drives for storage and data management.
The Space Shuttle's onboard computers and data management systems relied on hard disk drives.
Laptops utilized hard disk drives to provide portable storage solutions.
The first smartphone that integrated PDA features with mobile telephony required hard disk drives for data storage.
Mobile games needed the underlying data storage provided by hard disk drives.
The infrastructure for mobile banking applications depended on the storage solutions provided by hard disk drives for data processing and security.
The functioning laser itself relies on the principles of lasers and optical amplifiers.
Utilizes lasers for transmitting information through optical fibers over long distances.
Uses lasers to read and write data.
Employs lasers for higher density data storage and retrieval compared to DVDs.
Early models often used mechanisms involving lasers to read optical discs.
Modern smartphones integrate various laser technologies, including for biometric authentication and sensors.
Quantum computing systems like IBM Q System One can use lasers for precise manipulation of qubits.
The development and analysis of these vaccines involve laser-based techniques for imaging and detection at molecular levels.
El primer microprocesador comercial, que depende de la tecnología MOSFET.
Calculadoras portátiles basadas en circuitos integrados que utilizan MOSFETs.
Las primeras interfaces gráficas comerciales requerían de procesadores y memorias basadas en tecnología MOSFET.
Almacenamiento de estado sólido basado en celdas de memoria NAND Flash, que utilizan MOSFETs.
Dispositivos portátiles de reproducción de música requieren circuitos integrados que utilizan MOSFETs.
The functioning laser is critical for transmitting data through optical fibers.
In this case, the invention of the laser is implicitly contained within the development context.
Laptops inherently rely on a commercial graphical user interface for accessibility and user interaction.
Modern cell phones require a graphical user interface to function.
Although not on your list, Windows was the key example of a commercial graphical user interface and is essential for modern computing devices.
The first smartphone that combined a cell phone and PDA, utilizing a touchscreen graphical user interface.
Known for revolutionizing smartphones with a robust graphical user interface.
The Simon Personal Communicator introduced the first mobile apps, utilizing a capacitive touchscreen for user interaction.
The IBM Simon was the first smartphone, featuring a capacitive touchscreen.
The iPhone revolutionized smartphones, utilizing a capacitive touchscreen for its multi-touch functionality.
1. **first commercially available cell phone (1983)**: La batería de ion de litio permite la portabilidad y larga duración de los teléfonos móviles.
Los ordenadores portátiles dependen de baterías de larga duración para su diseño portátil.
Estos dispositivos requieren baterías ligeras y duraderas para la reproducción continua de música.
Los teléfonos inteligentes como el iPhone dependen de baterías de ion de litio para un uso prolongado y funcionalidad avanzada.
Los vehículos eléctricos Tesla utilizan baterías de ion de litio como fuente de energía principal.
Los vehículos autónomos requieren baterías de alto rendimiento para alimentar sus sistemas avanzados de computación y motores eléctricos.
Las máquinas cuánticas portátiles y otros dispositivos similares dependen de baterías de alto rendimiento para operar fuera de un entorno de laboratorio.
La portabilidad y la facilidad de uso de dispositivos médicos avanzados para diagnóstico y tratamiento pueden depender de baterías de ion de litio.
The development and application of CRISPR technology depend on accurate DNA sequencing to identify and target specific genetic sequences.
This technology requires precise DNA sequencing methods to analyze the genomic information of individual cells.
Autonomous vehicles rely heavily on GPS for navigation and positioning.

Geocaching is a recreational activity where participants use a GPS receiver or mobile device to hide and seek containers, called "geocaches," at specific locations marked by coordinates all over the world.
The development and widespread use of mobile web services often rely on GPS for location-based services and apps.
Many mobile apps, especially navigation and location-based services, depend on GPS technology to function.
Modern cell phones incorporate GPS technology for various applications including navigation, location tracking, and emergency services.
Solid-state drives rely on flash memory to store data in a more efficient and faster manner compared to traditional hard disk drives.
SIM cards use flash memory to store subscriber information and other necessary data for mobile network authentication.
This device, often considered the first smartphone, required flash memory to support its various mobile applications.
The IBM Simon was the first smartphone and used flash memory to function efficiently.
Portable MP3 players depend on flash memory to store and manage music files.
The iPhone relies on flash memory for storage purposes, including applications, photos, videos, and the operating system.
Based on understanding DNA sequences and profiles for targeted editing.
The MP3 format is the fundamental technology that enabled the development and function of the first portable MP3 players, allowing users to store and play compressed music files.
The MP3 format is crucial for SoundCloud as it allowed users to upload, stream, and share compressed audio files efficiently over the internet.
Podcasts depend heavily on the MP3 format for distributing audio content because it offers good sound quality with manageable file size, making it suitable for downloading and streaming.
While primarily a video platform, YouTube also relies on MP3 format for compressing audio streams, making it easier to handle and stream videos with audio content efficiently.
Although a video streaming service, Netflix uses MP3 or similar audio compression formats to decrease file sizes while maintaining acceptable audio quality for efficient streaming.
The iPhone’s multimedia capabilities include playing MP3 files. The MP3 format enables the device to handle a large library of music efficiently.
Some banking apps use MP3 format for secure voice verification processes, which require compact and manageable audio files.
The first Kindle supported MP3 playback, allowing users to listen to audiobooks and music using the same device.
Streaming platforms like Twitch use compressed audio formats, including MP3, to deliver sound efficiently alongside video content.
Mobile games that include music and sound effects used the MP3 format to efficiently manage audio files without burdening the limited storage and processing power of early mobile devices.
An early online dating service that relies on the World Wide Web for its functionality.
A video-sharing platform that operates through the World Wide Web.
Although it started as a DVD rental service, Netflix's streaming service operates via the World Wide Web.
A music streaming and distribution platform that is dependent on the World Wide Web.
A live streaming service primarily for gamers, accessible through the World Wide Web.
An outdoor recreational activity that utilizes the World Wide Web for distributing information about cache locations.
The significance here lies in the ability to download music via the World Wide Web.
A form of digital media distributed via the World Wide Web.
Although a biological invention, accessing data and collaboration for such complex projects heavily relies on the World Wide Web.
A precursor to blogging, which is content published primarily on the World Wide Web.
Requirió de la SIM card para funcionar de manera óptima en redes móviles.
Considerado el primer teléfono inteligente, dependía de la SIM card para acceso a la red móvil.
Desarrollado inicialmente para dispositivos móviles que usan SIM cards para acceso a redes móviles.
Necesita SIM cards para proporcionar conectividad a Internet móvil.
Algunos modelos posteriores requerían SIM cards para conexión a redes móviles.
Aplicaciones móviles para geocaching pueden requerir SIM cards para conectividad y GPS.
Depende de la SIM card para funcionalidad completa en redes móviles.
Requiere de SIM cards en dispositivos móviles para hacer transacciones seguras a través de la red móvil.
